title: Amazon launch first skincare brand and prices start at £8
text:
Yahoo is committed to finding you the best products at the best prices. We may receive a share from purchases made via links on this page.

Amazon may be your go to place for new technology and miscellaneous everyday items, but what about skincare?

Today the retailer have released its first own-brand skincare brand Belei - and it’s well worth a browse.

Having launched in the US earlier this year, the UK can finally get their hands on the luxury-looking (yet affordable) skincare line, which is made up of 19 products.

From a 24 hour moisturiser for sensitive skin to brightening vitamin booster serum, softening eye cream and cleansing charcoal mask, it has all areas of your skincare routine covered.

The products, all made in Switzerland, also feature key ingredients, including peptides, hyaluronic acid, vitamin E and charcoal - all of which help to fight dehydration, dullness and appearance of ageing.

Belei is made up of 19 products. [Photo: Amazon] More

“Belei offers a simple approach to skincare with products built around key ingredients with prove effectiveness. Always dermatologically tested, our products are developed to deliver results. Nothing less, nothing more” reads the description on the website.

Affordability is at the centre of the brand, where you can pick up a gentle cleansing milk and refreshing toner water for just £8.

At the higher end of the spectrum there is the Belei Vitamin Booster Serum (£20) that tightens and protect against premature skin ageing and Dark Circle Softening Eye Cream (£18).

The brand have also catered to different skin types, creating products are suitable for normal skin, sensitive and ultra sensitive.
